codeList="http://www.isotc211.org/2005/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_PresentationFormCode"                                                codeListValue="mapDigital">mapDigital</gmd:CI_PresentationFormCode>                </gmd:presentationForm>             </gmd:CI_Citation>          </gmd:citation>          <gmd:abstract>             <gco:CharacterString>This data set contains OCS block outlines (clipped) to the GOM Planning Area Boundary in ArcGIS shape file format for the BOEM Gulf of Mexico Region. OCS blocks are used to define small geographic areas within an Official Protraction Diagram (OPD) for leasing and administrative purposes. These blocks have been clipped along the Submerged Lands Act (SLA) boundary and along the Continental Shelf Boundaries. Additional details are available from: http://www.boem.gov/uploadedFiles/BOEM/Oil_and_Gas_Energy_Program/Mapping_and_Data/99-0006.pdfContains the block polygons clipped on the fedstate (SLA-boundary) as of March 15, 2013. Used ArcCatalog to create shape files. Shape files put at \\\\imsnolna04\\le\\shared\\GISPublicInfo.</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:abstract>          <gmd:purpose>             <gco:CharacterString>These block polygons and other cadastre information the BOEM produces are generated in accordance with 30 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 256.8 to support Federal land ownership and mineral resource management. Clipped block polygons from TIMS as of March 15, 2013</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:purpose>          <gmd:credit>             <gco:CharacterString>originally created by Chief Mapping and Automation Section-GOM</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:credit>          <gmd:status>             <gmd:MD_ProgressCode From Xpath: //enttyp--><gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>OBJECTID</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>Internal feature number.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>                <!--FGDC content not mapped to ISO. From Xpath: //attrdomv/udom--></gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>Shape</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>Feature geometry.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>                <!--FGDC content not mapped to ISO. From Xpath: //attrdomv/udom--></gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>BLK_CLIP_</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString/>                </gmd:descriptor>             </gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>BLK_CLIP_I</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString/>                </gmd:descriptor>             </gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>MMS_REGION</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>An unique identifier for the Minerals Management Service (MMS) Outer Continental Shelf</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>             </gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>MMS_PLAN_A</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>Indicates an Outer Continental Shelf (OCS) group of offshore blocks that are considered as an entity for administrative planning purposes. Four unofficial codes (LND, NEZ, NUS, and UND) are included to identify blocks outside of Federal jurisdiction.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>             </gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>PROT_NUMBE</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>The identifier of an official protraction, which can be one of two types as utilized by the Minerals Management Service (MMS): an Official Protraction Diagram (OPD) or Leasing Map. Official Protraction Diagrams (OPD's) and Leasing Maps depict approved subdivisions (blocks) of the OCS intended for leasing purposes. OPD's are constructed on the UTM Grid System and utilize the United Nations International Map of the World alpha- numeric numbering system. This worldwide system consists of main blocks (or zones) subdivided into minor blocks, which correspond to individual OPD's. Leasing Maps are the projection of a local (Lambert) State Plane Coordinate System Grid, onto the OCS. This system was developed prior to the more recent mapping system, which is comprised of the OPD's. Leasing Map coverage is limited to the near offshore areas of Louisiana, Texas, and southern California.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>             </gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>PROT_APRV_</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>The date the Official Protraction Diagram or Leasing Map is signed by the Federal Government and approved for distribution.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>             </gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>BLOCK_NUMB</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>Identifies a subdivision of an Official Protraction Diagram. An OCS block number is an unique and constant designation. However, if changes occur to the map grid system and/or coastline, some blocks could become larger or smaller, or be created or deleted. The total area in a block does not exceed 5,760 acres or 2,304 hectares.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>             </gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>BLK_FED_AP</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>The date that the OCS Block was established. Data Values:DD-MMM-YY Example: September 10, 1982 - stored as 10-sep-82</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>             </gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>BLOCK_LAB</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>The block_number data element value with the space formatting removed. For example, where a block_number value is " 128", the block_lab value would be "128"</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>             </gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>AC_LAB</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>The concatenation of the area_code data element value and the block_number data element value with the space formatting removed. For example, where a block_number value is " 128" and the area_code value is "MP", the AC_LAB value would be "MP128"</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>             </gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>AREA_CODE</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>The designated abbreviation assigned to Outer Continental Shelf (OCS) geographical units for identification purposes and for use on maps and in data bases.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>             </gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension> associated.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>             </gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band> </gmd:nameOfMeasure>                <gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>Coordinates values have been computed to .00000001 of a degree, but this shapefile is considered approximate. Where differences occur between the shapefile and the OPD and SOBD diagrams, the diagrams take precedence</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="missing"/>             </gmd:DQ_AbsoluteExternalPositionalAccuracy>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:report>             <gmd:DQ_CompletenessCommission>                <gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>Features represented have not been tested for completeness</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_CompletenessCommission>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:report>             <gmd:DQ_CompletenessOmission>                <gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>Features represented have not been tested for completeness</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_CompletenessOmission>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:report>             <gmd:DQ_ConceptualConsistency>                <gmd:measureDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>Tests for integrity have not been performed.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:measureDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_ConceptualConsistency>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:lineage>             <gmd:LI_Lineage>                <gmd:processStep>                   <gmi:LE_ProcessStep>                      <gmd:description>                         <gco:CharacterString>In house programs were used to protract offshore blocks OPD by OPD, on a UTM grid for the offshore areas. Additional boundaries, including the Submerged Lands Act boundary, the Continental Shelf boundary, and others were also computed and intersected with the OPD blocks. The resulting points were then stored in the TIMS database. Other in-house programs were used to create an ArcInfo Coverage from the data stored in the TIMS database. That coverage was converted into a shapefile using ArcGIS, and any portions of blocks landward of the SLA boundary of seaward of the CSB boundary were removed. The shapefile was further "dissolved" to remove any other internal boundary line, leaving only the block outlines.</gco:CharacterString>                      </gmd:description>
